page.title: 13The Southern Upland Way
page.content: The Southern Upland Way is a{long {distance footpath}which runs from Portpatrick on the East Coast to Cockburnspath on the West.It is 212 miles long.It goes through Castle Kennedy village and in front of the school.It then goes through part of the Stair Estate and along the road to New Luce.It opened officially in April 1984. We interviewed one of the walkers. He is Tom Neville from Glasgow.He had started from Portpatrick on Tuesday and reached us the next day.He thought the coast was lovely but did not like the parts on the roads.He had camped near our village so did not need any accomodation. Anyway there are very few places for the walkers to stay when they reach this section.He was looking forward to seeing the Castle Kennedy Gardens.
